dbms.bplus
Class PrimaryBPlusTree

java.lang.Object
  dbms.bplus.PrimaryBPlusTree
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class PrimaryBPlusTree
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

Implemenents a B+ Tree that is being used as a primary index to our DBMS System.

See Also:

Constant Field Values

root

private Node root
The root node.

firstLeaf

private PrimaryLeaf firstLeaf
The first leaf (PrimaryLeaf) of our B+ Tree.

bucketFactor

private final int bucketFactor
The bucket factor.

bucketFactorDiv2

private final int bucketFactorDiv2
The ceiling of the number of bucket factor divided by 2. It is used to define the maximum number of children a node to our B+ tree can have.

nextPageNumber

private int nextPageNumber
The next page number.

emptyRecord

private final Record emptyRecord
An empty record.

public PrimaryBPlusTree(int bucketFactor,
                        Record emptyRecord)
Initializes the primary B+ tree by assigning the bucket factor and an empty record taken from parameters and making the root and first leaf point at the same node.

Parameters:
bucketFactor - the bucket factor
emptyRecord - an empty record
Method Detail

search

private PrimaryLeaf search(int key)
Searches for a primary leaf using its key. When the primary leaf is found it is being returned.

Parameters:
key - the key of the primary leaf - target
Returns:
the desired (PrimaryLeaf) primary leaf

insert

public java.lang.Object[] insert(Record newRecord)
Inserts a new record to the appropriate position inside the Primary B+ Tree.

Parameters:
newRecord - the record to be inserted
Returns:
information (Object []) about the exact position that the new record was inserted in

splitPage

private Page splitPage(Page currentPage,
                       PrimaryLeaf currentLeaf,
                       PrimaryLeaf newLeaf,
                       java.util.LinkedList<Record> recordsMoved,
                       java.util.LinkedList<Reference> oldStatusList,
                       java.util.LinkedList<Reference> newStatusList)
Splits a replete page to two pages in order the new record which is trying to be inserted to seat. After the two pages have been created and the elements were splited and inserted to the appropriate pages all the secondary indexes are being updarted.

Parameters:
currentPage - the current page that is replete
currentLeaf - the current leaf
newLeaf - a new leaf to host half the records
recordsMoved - the records that were moved. We need them to update the secondary indexes.
oldStatusList - the old status of the list of records
newStatusList - the new status of the list of records
Returns:
the new page

splitPrimaryLeaf

private PrimaryLeaf splitPrimaryLeaf(PrimaryLeaf currentLeaf)
Splits a primary leaf to two and then children and the connections of them with their neighbours are being adjusted.

Parameters:
currentLeaf - the current primary leaf
Returns:
the new primary leaf

reconstructTree

private void reconstructTree(PrimaryLeaf currentLeaf,
                             PrimaryLeaf newLeaf,
                             Page newPage)
Reconstructs the tree in order to adjust it to changes that may have been happened (after a page and primary leaf's split).

Parameters:
currentLeaf - the current leaf
newLeaf - the new leaf
newPage - the new page

createNewParent

private void createNewParent(Node firstChild,
                             Node secondChild,
                             int key)
When the tree is being reconstructed some nodes may not have a parent. This method constructs a new parent and connects it to the orphan node(s).

Parameters:
firstChild - the fisrt vhild
secondChild -
key -

reconstructInnerNodes

private void reconstructInnerNodes(int key,
                                   InnerNode currentNode,
                                   Node newNode)
Reconstructs inner nodes after new nodes have been created (perhaps from a split procedure). Checks for replition take place too.

Parameters:
key - the current node's key
currentNode - the current node
newNode - the new node

splitInnerNode

private InnerNode splitInnerNode(InnerNode currentNode)
Splits an inner node to two and places half the children to the first and the other to the second. The parent(s) are being updated too.

Parameters:
currentNode - the node to be splited
Returns:
the new InnerNode

delete

public java.lang.Object[] delete(int primaryKey)
Deletes a record (the one with key equal to the given in the parameter) and updates the information to the primary B+ Tree, the references which were changed and the hard disk as well.

Parameters:
primaryKey - the desired key
Returns:
a Result [5] array which contains:
  • a boolean variable to verify the succeded deletion
  • a LinkedList object with the records and positions of the deleted records
  • three LinkedList objects which have information to update the references of the records which were moved after the deletion.

deleteAllGreaterOrEqual

public java.lang.Object[] deleteAllGreaterOrEqual(int primaryKey)
Like the delete method except here we delete all the records with key grater or equal to the one given to the parameter. We also do not update references beacause the way this kind of deletion takes place, it is not moving records inside the page.

Parameters:
primaryKey - the desired key
Returns:
a Result [5] array which contains:
  • a boolean variable to verify the succeded deletion
  • a LinkedList object with the records and positions of the deleted records
  • three LinkedList objects which have information to update the references of the records which were moved after the deletion. (they are not used in this method)

deleteAllLessOrEqual

public java.lang.Object[] deleteAllLessOrEqual(int primaryKey)
Like the delete method except that deletes all the records with key lesser or equal to the one given to the parameter. Then updates the information to the primary B+ Tree, the references which were changed and the hard disk as well.

Parameters:
primaryKey - the desired key
Returns:
a Result [5] array which contains:
  • a boolean variable to verify the succeded deletion
  • a LinkedList object with the records and positions of the deleted records
  • three LinkedList objects which have information to update the references of the records which were moved after the deletion.

delete

public java.lang.Object[] delete(java.util.LinkedList<Reference> referenceList)
It is used to delete records after a deletion made in a secondary index. It then updates the references to secondary indexes.

Parameters:
referenceList - the list with the references that were deleted to a secondary index
Returns:
a Result [5] array which contains:
  • a boolean variable to verify the succeded deletion
  • a LinkedList object with the records and positions of the deleted records
  • three LinkedList objects which have information to update the references of the records which were moved after the deletion.

delete

public java.lang.Object[] delete(int secondaryKey,
                                 int keyIndex)
Deletes records using the secondary key given from the parameters. It then updates all references needed. This method is necessarily sequential.

Parameters:
secondaryKey - the desired secondary key
keyIndex - the desired key's index
referenceList - the list with the references that were deleted to a secondary index
Returns:
a Result [5] array which contains:
  • a boolean variable to verify the succeded deletion
  • a LinkedList object with the records and positions of the deleted records
  • three LinkedList objects which have information to update the references of the records which were moved after the deletion.

deleteAllGreater

public java.lang.Object[] deleteAllGreater(int secondaryKey,
                                           int keyIndex)
Like the delete method except that deletes all the records with key greater to the secondary key given to the parameter. Then updates the information to the primary B+ Tree, the references which were changed and the hard disk as well. This method is necessarily sequential.

Parameters:
secondaryKey - the desired secondary key
keyIndex - the desired key index
Returns:
a Result [5] array which contains:
  • a boolean variable to verify the succeded deletion
  • a LinkedList object with the records and positions of the deleted records
  • three LinkedList objects which have information to update the references of the records which were moved after the deletion.

deleteAllLess

public java.lang.Object[] deleteAllLess(int secondaryKey,
                                        int keyIndex)
Like the delete method except that deletes all the records with key lesser to the secondary key given to the parameter. Then updates the information to the primary B+ Tree, the references which were changed and the hard disk as well. This method is necessarily sequential.

Parameters:
secondaryKey - the desired secondary key
keyIndex - the desired key index
Returns:
a Result [5] array which contains:
  • a boolean variable to verify the succeded deletion
  • a LinkedList object with the records and positions of the deleted records
  • three LinkedList objects which have information to update the references of the records which were moved after the deletion.

delete

public java.lang.Object[] delete(java.lang.String key,
                                 int keyIndex)
Like the delete method except that deletes all the records with a string key equal to the string key given to the parameter. Then updates the information to the primary B+ Tree, the references which were changed and the hard disk as well. This method is necessarily sequential.

Parameters:
key - String key according to which the deletions will be done
keyIndex - the index of the key
Returns:
a Result [5] array which contains:
  • a boolean variable to verify the succeded deletion
  • a LinkedList object with the records and positions of the deleted records
  • three LinkedList objects which have information to update the references of the records which were moved after the deletion.

find

public java.lang.Object[] find(int primaryKey)
Finds a record (the one with key equal to the given in the parameter) and returns it.

Parameters:
primaryKey - the desired key
Returns:
a Result [2] array which contains:
  • a boolean variable to verify the succeded search
  • a LinkedList object with the records that were chosen

findAllGreaterOrEqual

public java.lang.Object[] findAllGreaterOrEqual(int primaryKey)
Like the find method except here we search for all the records with key greater or equal to the one given to the parameter.

Parameters:
primaryKey - the desired key
Returns:
a Result [2] array which contains:
  • a boolean variable to verify the succeded search
  • a LinkedList object with the records that were chosen

a Result [2] array which contains:

  • a LinkedList object with the records that were chosen

Parameters:
referenceList - the list with the references that we want to find
Returns:
a Result [2] array which contains:
  • a boolean variable to verify the succeded search
  • a LinkedList object with the records that were chosen

                               int keyIndex)

referenceList - the list with the references that were deleted to a secondary index
Returns:
a Result [2] array which contains:

  • a LinkedList object with the records that were chosen

findAllInRange

public java.lang.Object[] findAllInRange(int firstPrimaryKey,
                                         int lastPrimaryKey)
Like the find method except that finds all the records in the open gap between the values of the primary keys given to the parameters.

Parameters:
firstPrimaryKey - the first key
lastPrimaryKey - the last key the index of the key
Returns:
a Result [2] array which contains:
  • a boolean variable to verify the succeded search
  • a LinkedList object with the records that were chosen

findAllInRange

public java.lang.Object[] findAllInRange(int firstSecondaryKey,
                                         int lastSecondaryKey,
                                         int keyIndex)
Like the find method except that finds all the records in the open gap between the values of the secondary keys given to the parameters. This method is necessarily sequential.

Parameters:
firstSecondaryKey - the first key
lastSecondaryKey - the secondary key
keyIndex - the index of the key
Returns:
a Result [2] array which contains:
  • a boolean variable to verify the succeded search
  • a LinkedList object with the records that were chosen
